Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish and label it as a living thing.
The student can represent the water as the place where the fish lives and label it.
The student can show and label the resources the fish needs to survive, like water and food.
The student can illustrate relationships between the fish and its environment, showing how the fish uses water and other resources to live.
The student can demonstrate how different parts of the habitat work together to help the fish survive, like plants that provide oxygen in the water.
